articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The release, which could come as early as Monday, could open the way to freeing the rest of the 59 hostages still held in Gaza.
articles.title: Israel says not committed to Hamas ceasefire, only to safe corridor for U.S. hostage release

articles.author: Tim Cocks
articles.description: The first 49 white South Africans deemed victims of racial discrimination and granted refugee status under an offer by U.S. President Donald Trump were flying to the U.S. on Monday in a move deepening frictions between the two nations.
articles.title: First white South Africans fly to US under Trump refugee plan

articles.author: Doina Chiacu, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump dismissed ethical concerns about his plan to accept an airplane as a gift from the Qatari royal family, saying on Monday it would be "stupid" to turn down the generous offer.
articles.title: Trump says it would be 'stupid' not to accept gift of Qatari plane

articles.author: Emma Farge, Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: The United States and China said on Monday they have agreed a deal to slash reciprocal tariffs for now as the world's two biggest economies seek to end a trade war that has disrupted the global outlook and set financial markets on edge.
articles.title: US and China reach deal to slash trade tariffs

articles.author: Karen Lema, Mikhail Flores
articles.description: Former Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte was almost certain to be elected mayor of his home city by a landslide on Monday, unimpeded by his detention at the International Criminal Court on charges of murder as a crime against humanity.
articles.title: Detained in The Hague, Philippines' Duterte wins hometown mayoral election

articles.author: Barbara Erling
articles.description: Poland summoned the Russian ambassador and said it would close the Russian consulate in Krakow after evidence showed Moscow was responsible for a huge fire that almost completely destroyed a Warsaw shopping centre in 2024.
articles.title: Poland to close Russian consulate in Krakow, citing arson attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The prime minister of junta-ruled Guinea announced a new date of December 2025 for elections, seeking to reassure investors in a speech at an African business forum on Monday.
articles.title: Guinea's prime minister announces elections in December 2025

articles.author: James Mackenzie
articles.description: Israeli officials have put a brave face on U.S. President Donald Trump bypassing them on a Middle East trip this week, but his decision to do so is the latest to sow doubt in Israel about where it stands in Washington's priorities.
articles.title: As Trump heads to the Gulf, Israel asks where it stands

articles.author: Luc Cohen, Jack Queen
articles.description: Hip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial is due to kick off with opening statements on Monday, with prosecutors set to argue that the Bad Boy Records founder used his fame and fortune to abuse women and the defense expected to counter that there is nothing criminal about a "swingers" lifestyle.
articles.title: Sex trafficker or 'swinger'? Hip-hop mogul Sean 'Diddy' Combs goes on trial

articles.author: Ariba Shahid, Charlotte Greenfield
articles.description: The recent military escalation with arch-rival India won't have a large fiscal impact on Pakistan and can be managed within the current fiscal space, with no need for a new economic assessment, Pakistan's Finance Minister said in an interview with Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: Pakistan finance minister: conflict with India won't have large fiscal impact
